page.title: 02NATIONAL PARK WARDEN
page.content: Mr.Collins is one of the four wardens who look after Exmoor.It is their job to see that people can enjoy the National Park in Safety.Most land on Exmoor is owned privately,much by the National Trust. There are many foot paths,bridle ways and special camp sites so people can enjoy many different outdoor activities.Some of the National Park is Woodland.Mr Collins and his helpers manage some of it.They cut down mature trees and replant with mixed native broadleaf trees grown in a nursery near Allerford.Much of the National Park is farmland.Visitors must follow the country code and farmers should keep footpaths clear.Mr.Collins sometimes helps settle disputes between visitors with dogs and farmers with sheep.A worry is heathland catching fire.
